text: Bottled. Pours hazy yellow with a firm if short-lived head. Aroma of lemon, hay, and salt. Tart and acetic, light bodied and perfect low alcohol beverage in Texas weather
750 ml bottle pours golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus and funk. Taste is spice, lemons, lime and tart. Needs to be a smaller bottle or shared.

Last beer of 2016? Well see. Hazy straw color with a fading white head. Great aroma, hay, salt, honey, spice. Flavor is dry and tart, lemon, cinnamon, touch of honey sweetness. Feel is crisp as hell with lively carbonation. Really solid!

Draft at F and Co, hazy golden with an average sized head and lace. Notes of sourdough bread, salt, lactic lemon, coriander, orange rind and other spices. Body is medium for the style. I could def see this being a good beverage to consume before picking up the kids from soccer practice
Bottle: Cloudy gold with a small head. Mild aroma with classic sour flavors but also with an amazing mild cinnamon or pumpkin spice finish. Extra points for creativity.

Pours pale yellow, touch of haze, with a small white head. Aroma is orange, lime and brine. Taste is more sour than tart with some salty undertones. Light bodied, slick with a crisp finish. Well rounded.
On tap at Gourmet Haus Staudt in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is light funk, citrus. Taste is mild sour citrus (maybe kumquat, sour orange) with some great salt notes. Very refreshing / summery.

Hazy beige golden in color... Aroma of citrus, peach, lime, salt... Flavor tastes like peach cobbler, lots of saltiness balanced by notes of lime, vanilla, peach, and spices... Maybe some cinnamon... Really enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells of funk sulfur and citrus. Hazy peach small island of head. Beautiful growth of citrus and lime out of a nice tart smooth base. Leave awesome lime stain behind.

Cloudy golden yellow. Aroma is lemon.

Aroma is briny: pickles and lemons. There is a touch of honeydew melon. 

Flavor is beautifully salty sour. Touch of the balsamic, but more puckery tangerine. Or at equally. 

Feels slick and buttery to the touch. This is doing the job: tart, salty, lemons, melons, and Im sure other anagrams. Really good.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2016 Draft at Bru Craft. Hazy yellow/orange pour with some soft white foam. Splashes of lace. Piquant sour. Unusual citrusy, salty, spicy flavors. Orange/lemon/lime peels. Sea salt. Coriander. Pimento. Whiskey sour mix. Not entirely working for me but unique and refreshing.

Draught at Beer Hall. Amber color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, orange peel, sea salt, ripe fruits, earthy notes and grass. Sour finish with citrus, sea salt, earthy notes, ripe fruits, tart and grass. Excellent gose.
Tap. Less than clear orange yellow. Oranges, some salt, sour notes as well in the aroma. Citrusy sour, saltier middle and dry spice finish. Lighter body with tight carboantion.
On tap at Torst tap takeover. Poured light haze yellow orange with white head. Aroma citrusy urinal cake. Light carb med bod. Taste light sour min salty good lime lemon citrus.

On tap at Milagro beer brunch, clear yellow colour with weak white foam. I often dislike the gose style, but tgis is a particularly enjoyable one, more like a Berliner weiss. Tart and grainy, light, just a little sour, enhanced by the citric acidity.
Sampled as esbls. Poured into the tasting glass was was yellow. Lemon nose and some salt. Medium body. Flavor of bitter lemon. Light salt and citrus in finish. Good.
Draft. Mostly clear golden yellow with no head. Aroma of salt, wheat, and tart stone fruits. Taste is sweet and tart summer stone fruit, wheat, and salt in the finish. Quenching with a dry finish.
Bread floral roses in a slightly hazy straw golden, medium effervescence, lightly acidic, refreshing.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and snifter served showing a hazed, light golden, nearly straw hue, with a modest layer of white head foam that produced a thin, persistent ring, light film, and dots & dashes of lacing. The nose was tart, lemon & lime, with a hint of cracker/wheat. Light bodied, with a touch of rind-like bitterness, the sour/acidic nature in combination with a light salinity, made the fair carbonation almost inconsequential in the taste, but still would have liked it to linger at that level or better a bit longer. Fairly refreshing, nonetheless.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with a thin head and aromas of brine, lemon and a bit of barn funk. Flavor is delicious. That odd mix of salt and sour that only comes from a gose and has you hoping the next one you try isnt complete toilet water... Lovely!
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 5oz draft pour at Whole Foods Old Town Alexandria. Poured a hazy, pale yellow color with a small fizzy white head. Aroma was light lemon notes. Not a lot of fizzy, salty character that Ive come to expect from a gose. Flavor was light bitter lemon, light citrus. Not a lot of tartness in this one.

On draught at Cafe Benelux, Milwaukee. Appearance: Golden like apple juice, with a moderate white head and nice lacing. Head hangs in quite long for the acidity. 
Aroma: Key lime pie! A touch of acidity and lemon as well. 
Taste: Salted lime, like the aftermath of a tequila shot, with a light orange citrus flavor and a low but pleasant acidity that is moderately tart for the style. 
Mouthfeel: Light body with a low to moderate carbonation. Could be a little undercarbonated.
Finish: Very dry and sticky on the tongue, with some lingering salted lime and moderate tartness. 
Overall: The salt/lime combo is a nice juxtaposition and play off a tequila shot. Aroma smells like a key lime pie, and the moderately high acidity delivers a refreshing tartness. Well done
Really tart. Puckering almost. Salty. Nearly clear. Not my kind of thing but decent.

Copper Cliff, Brooklyn tap: pours golden with a white head. Aroma is lemon and minerals. Taste is really salty and really full of minerals. This is really saltier than most other goses. It is to the point that it may be too salty. For sure.
On tap at lucille. Pale yellow, aroma is grapefruit, taste is very sour and citrus. Light puckering and refreshing
Sample tap at Milk and Hops, Chelsea. White head. Aroma is lemon, lime, tart funk. Flavor is tart funk, lemon, orange, lime, sea salt. Not overly acidic. Great gose. Well done.

[ keg ][ 5oz ][ @Flying Saucer ][ $5 ][ mini tumbler ][ 06.04.16 ]
hazy straw, thin white head drops to oily island. Toasty grain nose, wheat and even cinammon. Heavy citric acid (lemon) front palate, pie crust spices and dough across mid before spicy finish, fizzy thin body. The weird cinammon / pie notes are out of place.
Bottle from Premier. Pretty good drinking summer ale, fairly intense orange-lemon flavour. Worth trying, salt residue on the tongue.

Bottle 750ml. [ As Perennial Suburban Beverage ].Unclear - hazy matt medium yellow color with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, pale malt, light to moderate hoppy, lemon, lime, salty, moderate yeasty. Flavor is moderate sweet and light acidic with a long duration, salty, lime, lemon. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150927]

Slightly hazy golden with a thin white ring of sticky foam. Big gose-like lemony Belgian toasty nose. And a touch of fruitiness on the aroma as well. Big salty and tart flavor, nice punch of blonde graininess, a touch of lemon, and a dry tart finish. Big and bold but bone dry and salty.

Bottle thanks to bytemesis I think. Pours slightly hazy pale yellow with a small white head. Nose is tart with light orange and lemon citrus. Taste is sharply tart at first. Followed by a citrus zest. Very nice.
(Draught) Pours a hazy yellow body with a spare white head. Aroma orange, lime, lemon, and grain. Flavor of yogurt, lime, orange, grain, and briney with a somewhat dry finish.
Really neat take with added fun. Light lemonpepper scent. Taste is sour, but sweetness is found. Lemon, grassy, and sweet bread taste. Sour vinegar mouth feel. Light yellow. Tap

750 ml bottle poured a hazy gold with a lingering ring of white foam. Aromas of straw, saltiness, lemon, lime and yeast. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry lightly tart finish. Flavors of straw, lemon, lime, saltiness and light yeast with a crisp dry lightly tart lingering lemon lime finish.

Draft 12 Oz pour at the Collective. Rating #1942, the birth year of the Grand Coulee Dam. Really, thats what you are going with? Pours a glowing gold color with a thin fizz head. Soft apple aroma. Really interesting flavor here. Apple up front, much more sour than sweet. Sour lingers with a late hint of salt. Delicious beer really. This is how a gose should be. Enjoyed this.

Un grand merci à Jean-François pour le partage de cette bière qui fit lunanimité! Dépourvu de toute mousse, le liquide présente une robe riche et affirmée. Un nez darômes complexes, quelques fois fruitées, quelques fois vineuses, trahit une maîtrise du vieillissement en barriques. Une douce noix de coco et une touche de vanille, on se croirait à la plage, une bouteille de crème solaire à la main. En bouche lacidité est progressive. Cest dabord le fruit salin qui frappe puis sinstalle une douce acidité surette qui accompagne parfaitement la lime, le tout reposant sur un corps assez rond et même légèrement beurré. Mes glandes salivaires sactivent suite à cette finale mi sèche et surette. Je crois sincèrement quil sagit de la meilleure Gose que jai bu à ce jour!

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, hazy orange pour with thin fizzy white head, aroma brought lime juice, lemon, salty notes with a hint of orange, touch of bread notes with a hint of spice. Taste was a mix of lemon, orange, slight bread into nice salty notes, hints of more citrus, finishing fairly tart, slightly salty. Nice beer.
Taste og grape, orange and key lime nice Gose, very refreashing nice Summer drink. Low ABV 4.2 percent

Tap at Star Bar in Denver, while you stupid co-workers were outside at an oktoberfest drinking piss .. . tangy stuff, complex for even a gose .. . summer time in a class, a zesty enterprise .. . . oh, scat. Out of all the aspects of jazz, scat has got to be the worst, the main offender.
Cool beer!!! Hazed yellow, white head. Salty, sour, wheat, lemon-lime, great balance of salty and sour.

Tap at lunch at Mekong. Wife had a glass, and then I got one too. Pours a pale yellow, slight head. Aroma is wheat, lemon, bit of spice, perhaps coriander. Flavor matches, bit of a salt note. Very, very refreshing. Nice stuff. Love seeing gose of all things making a splash these days. And impressed by Perennial as well.
On tap at Maxs. Pours a clear gold with a thin white head. Soft herbal notes, wheat, musk. Lemon and bread, tart acid, salt. Loads of acid, lemony and briny. Lingering salt and citric acid. Lovely.
Tangy citrus, lots of it. Hazy golden pour with ok head. Pretty sour finish. Light salt. Tap at churchkey thanks to iphonephan.
On draft at Churchkey during the 2015 Oerebbuak Abraxax Launch Party. Pours a cloudy pale gold with an off white head. Aroma of lemon. Flavors of sour lemon and lime. Tart and refreshing.

Pale yellow, and a huge head. I may have poured it too quickly, to be honest. Really fizzy, sounds like a 7Up or something. Smells like salt risen bread and sea air. Taste is a weird but appealing mix of sea air and tropical fruit, plus some subtle woody and vanilla notes, and maybe some cranberry. I liked it...
Draft at Uber Tavern. Clear golden pour, dense white head. Nose and flavor hold good salinity, key lime, lemon zest, tangy lactic kick. Very tasty.
Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing! Pours hazy deep golden colour with a mid-sized white head. Aroma of pale malt, yeast, slightly sour notes. Taste of sour malt, pale malt, grain, dry mild hops.
Bottle. Hazy yellow pour with white head. Fruit, berry, salt and tart aromas. Sweet Flavors, tart finish, salty tones as well.

Very nice sourish nose like horse blanket. The beer starts slightly salty-sourish, easy to drink. Nice fresh sourish body, the level of sourness i moderate but still with depth. Fresh sourish aftertaste. Very refreshing and smooth. Great!

Tap at the Watershed.

Light brown pour, very little head. Gently tart nose. Refreshing beer, some citrus, gently tart, none of the lactic vomit of the real thing and very little of the salt. This is a delicious version of the American reinterpretation of the style.
Draft at red apron in DC. Nice tart citrus fruit but also good body. To be expected. Well made and good presence.

Bottle @ La Palma Sour Fest 2015. Nice golden colored beer with some haze and a white head. Nice citrusy lemon and lime aromas. Slight salinity, some spice, and a hint of peach. Has kind of a sourdough note to the flavor along with plenty of lime, lemon, and an overall citrus zest quality. Subtle spice and salt, some cracker, and a hint of bready sweetness. Quite refreshing and nice.

Aroma: Tart Lemons, Wheat, Mild Salt

Appearance: Golden Straw Hue, Passes Lots of Light, White Head Ring, Mild Lacing

Taste: Tart Lemons, Lime Juice, Mildly Salty

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Salty, Mild Bitter

Bottle shared by Bvery, thanks! Pours a near clear earthy gold with a white head that dissipates completely. Aroma has a rich earthy fruit note with a bit of hibiscus and some light grains. Flavor has hibiscus and tart fruits up front with a bit of wheat supporting.
Bomber. Mostly clear light golden pour. White head. Juicy lime and mild orange. Light bright palate. Good.
Bottle. Hazy yellow with a small head. Nose of key lime and tropical fruit. Salty driftwood. Some sour cream. Similar flavor. Mineral, fruit skin. Light citrus tartness. Light body, a touch soupy.
Bottle. Clear yellow pour with a white head. Sour lemon aromas. Tart with lemon and lime citrus highlights. Muted caramel malt backbeats. light and easy sippin.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a glass. Clear dull yellow with medium bright white head. Aroma is tart, medium/light body, little carbonation, and good lacing. Taste is tart, salty, some lemon, hints or orange, and long nice tart key lime finish. Enjoyable.

[9/27/15] Bottle sample at Borefts After Festival 2015 in Rotterdam. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Muddy milky yellow. Sourish aroma, citric, a bit lactic. Sourish flavor, lactic, citric and salty. Light-bodied. Very nice.
Tap..Pour is yellow with a white head..Nose is lime peel, tart, funk, dry, spice..Tatse is lemon, spice, funk, tart, nice citrus..

9/12/15. 750mL bottle from Friar Tuck in Peoria. Golden pour with a nice off-white head. Big acidic aroma, crackers, tons of keylime. Awesome flavor, refreshing and delicious, loads of key lime, sour, a dash of salt balances it out. Good stuff!

Pours somewhat unclear amber with a small white head. Aroma is light citrus zesty and even salty as a proper gose should be, refreshing and summery. Flavor is tart and lemony and lightly dry and tamarind tangy, nicely subtle salted as well.
Pours golden with a slim white head. Pretty sour. Very acidic mouth feel, probablly too much acid. Light body.

Thx! for sharing fonefan (+ kermis for being the original sharer). 750 ml. bottle sampled @ BAF 2015. Super milky juicy murky beer. Nose is sweet mineral, light sour, big lime juice, tad salt, lemon peel. Taste is key lime juice, murky lactic, lemon juice, weird, light mineral, weird murky, low carbonation. Big key lime, odd milky sour lime style. Dont fully get it but fine enough.

On tap at Road 34 last week. Clear orange appearance with a white head that quickly dissipates to nothing. The nose is light mineral brininess with herbal notes, citrus zest, light spice and a touch of salt with hints of cinnamon or nutmeg or something. Similar flavor, adding some tartness. Solid gose overall.

750 ml bottle from dbsdelight - thanks again, Dan! Pours a cloudy gold with a small white head that settles into a film and ring. Aroma of lime, lemon, and orange citrus, salt, sourdough, straw, and light yogurt. The flavor is a more tart version of the same. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a clean, tart, refreshing mouthfeel and dry finish. Really nice and citrusy and tart. Great summer beer. Glad I opened it on what is probably one of the last warm evenings around here this season.
Overripe lemon aroma. Hazy golden, thin head. Very tart lemon and lime. Light to medium body, spritzy.

Bottle shared thanks to RandomStrangerNL. Pours very hazy pale golden with a small white head. Aroma of salty citrus, fresh lemon and lime. Flavour is moderate sour and salty. Light bodied with light fizzy carbonation.

Tap - fair size foamy head, pale gold straw color, very effervescent, mildly fruity aroma and flavor, light sweet wheat like backbone, fairly tart finish, pretty good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Capitol Beer in Sacramento, CA. Pours Slightly hazy light gold with a white head. Aroma is mildly citrus fruit. Med body. Flavor is citrus tart, maybe a tad earthy. Finishes well towards dry, a little mouth puckering, citrus. Something of a wow.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2016 Bottle to plastic :(
Ginger, corn, lemon. Light yellow with a thin white head. Taste is lemon, salt, ginger. 

Updating with a draft to taster - originally 3.6
Consummation: Sour lacto lemon
Adjunct: Strong sour lemon wuth peach aromatics; hazy light amber with a frothy white head; no ginger this time
25.4oz bottle. Hazy gold tone with a low white head. Puckering key lime nose & taste with nice saltiness to back it up. Smooth yet tart - more sour than most goses.
On tap at Capitol Beer & Tap room. Pours golden with a nice off-white head and a spicy sour citrus flavor with lots of salt. Very much like a traditional Gose and very refreshing.

Draft at Mission Delores. It pours clear very pale gold with a decent white head. The nose is fresh, lemon sherbet, limeade, white grape and minerals. The taste is crisp, clean, tart, acidic, zesty line, pithy lemon, white grape, gooseberry, minerals and some saltiness with a dry finish. Light body and fine, foamy carbonation. Decent, if a touch acidic.
Draft at The Yard, Seattle. Lightly tart, clean and crisp. Medium body, very clean. Fairly mild, I loved it.

Poured from a tap. Hazy straw color, medium white head. Medium sour aroma. Medium body with a light sour mild key lime flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a tap. Part of a sour flight at The Birch. Cloudy orange appearance. Sour milk aroma. Translates unfortunately to the taste as well. Some citrus.
Pours a hazy golden orange with a thick white head. Aroma of sour wheat, key lime pie and lacto. Taste is sour wheat, funk, key limes and salt. Like a key lime pie gose. I love it.

750 capped bottle from Whole Foods PM. Pours turbid dark straw with frothy, white head. Nose is heavy orange peel, lemon, hops. Tastes very tart, with lemon orange zest, lime, and some spicy notes. Comes off like a fruitier Berliner weiss.

On tap. Served a hazy golden color with small head that fades quickly, Aroma of fruit, in particular lime and orange. Taste is quite tart with a fruity zest. Tart feel that lingers a bit. Moderate body, nicely balanced for the style. Not one of my go to styles but this is worth checking out.
750 ml. bottle. Pours a somewhat cloudy golden orange with a decent white head. Aroma of tart fruit, yeast, and grain. Taste is lemon, lime, yeast, wheat, and some salt. Interesting in a good way.
Tart, refreshing, delicious. Im not a HUGE fan of the recent Gose beer trend but this one is a really solid offering.
750ml bottle pours a hazy orange with a large white head. tart salt lemon and lime with a sweet orange taste.

Large shared bottle.
Pale and cloudy body.
Moderately sour with plenty of citrus. Quite lemony.
Light but not watery body with lively, excellent carbonation.

At Great Taste of the Midwest, 2015. Key lime in the flavor for sure, as well as in the aroma. Lime stays on the palate for some time. it is sour, probably more sour than I expect from a gose. Hazy gold color, white head. Good flavor, they worked the lime in well.

Hazy gold. Nose of cherry lime with spice, sour and mild salt. Flavor is limeade, sour citrus, light lactic with biscuity wheat and mild vanilla in the finish. Pretty good, but tiring a bit of the gose craze. Moving on.
At De Garde. Pours a clear orange color with a medium white head. A crazy funky fruity nose, lime and salt. The flavor is citrus, lime, cinnamon, salt. Lemons and toast.

Bottle - Soapy, Woody and odd fruity dry dusty notes. Cloudy gold with a small white head. Very effervescent and carbonated, fleshy fruit. Sweet and odd, with a bit off feet and a clean finish. I was told the colour looked different than other bottles, may have been an off bottle?

Bottle at De Garde, pours an opaque golden orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out lightly tart notes, some earth and strange salty notes. Flavour is fairly complex, with light salt, cinnamon, tart light fruits and some earth. What a strange blend of different notes. Cant really put my finger on this. Strange stuff.
Cloudy yellow gold, white head. Citrus tang, allspice, honey. Quite a lot of tanginess, malt finish. Salty. Chewy, light mouthfeel. Medium finish. Great.

Draft:
Fairly clear gold with a small white head.
Sour lemon/lime, yeast aroma.
Tart, salty, lime and lemon, wheat flavours.
Tangy...
Really good.
Tap at sb. Pours a hazy burnished dark gold with a loose white head. Big tart salty lemony nose. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Salty, lemony mid palate. Long tart finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy light golden, small white head, dissipates leaving some residual and lacing. Aroma is quite citrusy, dust, a bit of hay, sea air. Flavor is lime juice, citrus zest, a hint of saltiness, some wheat. The lime is a perfect balance to the light saltiness of the gose. Light tart overall and highly refreshing. Light plus body, prickly carbonation. I love gose.
Yellow draft pour at jakes. White head. Makes your cheeks pucker. Tart and sour. Leaves your mouth dry. Other than all that it's good
Draft. Hazed golden pour. Citrus witbier nose very salty flavor. Not the best this style has to offer.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good for the style; a cloudy (almost milky) pale apricot with fizzy white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells solid; semi-tart with notes of wheat, lemon, lime, and salt. Tastes like it smells, but better, with a nice lactic presence and a touch of orange peel. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied, pleasantly tart, and semi-dry. Good stuff.
draft at AllenBurgerVenture & Blue Monk, Buffalo NY. great gose. citrus, lime, orange peel & pith. light saltiness, tart, refreshing, really good
On draft at Bigelos. Clear deep golden. A funky bretty aroma also has some nice fruit. Lemon and zest with soft malts. Just a little salty. Spices. Very refreshing and enjoyable.
(Draft) Cloudy yellow, whisp of white head. Flavor has meyer lemon and keylime, yeast, slight bitterness and sourness. Bread aroma. Lots of carbonation.

Draft at pony bar hk with frank dad. Pours a clear golden with no head of lace. Aroma is pie crust, cinnamon and tart fruit. Mouthfeel is super tart and sour with notes of key lime pie, sour lemons, funk and earthy spice. Great stuff.

Bottle to glass. Pours a clear light golden color with an off white head. Aroma isnt much to write home about, light, dry, touch of tart. Flavor has an excellent blend of tart, salt, key lime. Wonderfully drinkable.

Bottle. It poured a pale golden color with a white head. The aroma was of citrus, salt and key limes. The taste was similar to the aroma with some tartness, mild sweetness from the lime juice and a light body crispy mouthfeel. Nice.
Pour at the Great Taste of the Midwest. Slightly hazy light yellow pour. Citrus nose. Medium sourness. Lime zest and orange pith. Quite nice!
Bright, Citrus, effervescent, tart, hints of salinity, but extremely refreshing. Delicious really cold. Almost like a cocktail but smooth.
Tap. Pale hazy golden with small head. Quite tart with very nice key lime flavor. Beyond the sour kick, theres solid depth of flavor. Excellent.
Draft. Medium white head atop cloudy straw body. Aroma is medium sweet, lemon, salt, light funk. Taste is salt, some lemon. Light-medium body, light stickiness.
Tap @ the Answer. Hazy light yellow with pretty white head. Light tart aroma with wheat. Nice lemony flavor. Crisp.

On tap at Whole Foods Fair Lakes pours a murky yellow with some frothy, white head. Nose has lemon and yogurt, almost a sweet lemon sherbert, some candle, some straw. Flavor is tart, lemon, white grape, light lemon candy, straw, yeast, a little briny. Medium tart finish. Pretty solid.

On tap. Madison, wi. 

Pours hazy pale yellow. Zero head. 

Aroma is sour. Lemon and citrus. Hay notes. 

Taste is sour and sweet. 

Body is light. Thin texture. Short finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours a hazy yellow with no head. The aroma is strong lime, sea salt, wheat. Thin mouth, tart lime, sea salt, dough, crisp and crushable, very nice.
Bottle thanks to Keir. Pours orange white head. Nose/taste of sea salt, lime juice, lemon peel, sour wheat, coriander and orange peel - Light bodied.

750 ml bottle acquired from Binnys South Loop (Chicago, IL). Pours a hazy golden yellow hue, healthy haziness in the body with frothy carbonation driven head. A firmer layer quickly dissipates to a mellow film and ringer with decent lacing. A nice summery citrus sunny glow through the body. Aromas show sea salt and earth, a bit of spiciness, bread and citrus hit the palate with jabs of coriander, mellow fruit ester coming in and some yeasty life, spice, and lactic acidity. Lime juice, orange rind oils and some pithy life. Dry, a bit grainy and tart as that bitter citric appeal sets in. Initial is lighter end of the fold in body, a touch of body with salty and spritzy sourness. Some salty mineral appeal, firmer lactic acidity up front with bitter orange rind and juice, bready malts and a bit of straw. Earth, yogurt and that distinct citric dominance. Lime juice, orange rind really are distinct. Gentle fruity ester, pear and pineapple into the middle withh dryness, flaked wheat, salt and some twangy yogurty lactic appeal hanging on for the ride as we round the corner. Finish is dry, a bit grainy and flaked wheat with that firmer lactic element hanging on, the saltiness more distinguished and at its peak at this finish. Twangy lactic appeal, dry, salty finish. I dig this, the citrusy additions add some really nice pop up front. The pour is solid, the carbonation spritzy with a firm to potent lalctic appeal and salty finish. Enough body to make it a beer (as opposed to just sourness), light enough to drink a good deal of overall. Nice. Nose a touch stale or mellow perhaps, but this one finds strength in its flavor and flow.

Bottle - 750mL crowned. Hazy golden pour with a strong, fizzy white head. Salt and citrus dominate the aroma along with yogurt, wheat and yeast. Taste is essentially a salted slice of Key Lime Pie. The lime and grains make up the pie flavor. The salt is there. Light lemon as well and the yeast rounds it out. Body is light, tart and refreshing with a strong bubbly and prickly carbonation. Ends with more Key Lime Pie and slat with yeast notes and unsweetened lemonade. Yummy!

750 ml bottle. Pours a pale golden with a slight off white head. Aroma of lime, citrus peel, and salt. Flavor has a medium tartness, a medium salinity, with mild sweetness from the lime juice towards the finish. Light bodied, crisp mouthfeel, above average carbonation. Wonderful.

On tap: The aroma consists of moderate-heavy lemon juice, light salt, citrus, and wheat. Its a hazy dull yellow with a small white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of citrus with a hint of wheat. The finish has moderate lemon juice, light salt, and a touch of must. Its light bodied with light-moderate carbonation. Overall, this is insanely drinkable and refreshing...but it really tastes like lemon juice has been flat out been added to the beer. Whatever though, I could drink this all day

On draft at Whole Foods in Alexandria, VA.

Hazy stop light yellowish orange body with a small collar. Aromas of lemon, malt, stone fruit. Light, tart, flavorful, drinkable, refreshing.

750mL bottle. Hazy, pale straw yellow, creamy white head with very nice retention and lace. Nose is funk, earthiness, limes, dry grass. Mouth is nicely tart, medium bodied, creamy with key lime spiciness, lemon and faint orange, bread dough, salt in the finish This would be an interesting one to age in tequila barrels. Excellent brew for these muggy July evenings in Chicago.
750-ml bottle from craftbeertemple. fizzy foamy head. cloudy pale yellow. sweet nose. expected tart, salt. surprised by fruit. is all this salty beer going to make my blood pressure go up?
Draft. Hazy to cloudy golden yellow color, creamy white head. Aroma of earthy lemon lime. Taste is softly sour citrus, mostly lime. Tasty and refreshing

Randomly found this for six bucks at a Kroger. Nice! Hazy pale straw, large foamy white hear, fair head retention. Aroma of strong lacto, bready malt, pithy lime, brine. The taste is salt, lime, pale biscuit malt, lacto. Medium bodied, mild lingering tartness. Solid, refreshing.
Big bottle. Cloudy bright gold lots of head. Very salty and limey. Tart funky finish. Shockingly good.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of lemon lime, salt, oranges. Tastes of lemon lime and juicy oranges, tart acidic notes, lime zest, salt. Light body with a dry finish. Great stuff.

Pours orangeish with not much of a head. The aroma has sharp citrus, mild malt, salt, tartness, peaches, key lime and a bit of rich sweetness lingering in the back. It has a medium body that is smooth for a gose with light sharp carbonation. The flavor starts fruit with smooth citrus that is heavy on the key lime. There is also salt, light tart bite, lemons and some spice. The finish has a pleasant refreshing bite. Nice.
